newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore issues arrest warrant for politician.
newsitem.headline: Singapore issues arrest warrant for politician.

text.p: A Singapore court issued an arrest warrant on Friday for embattled opposition politican Tang Liang Hong on charges of tax evasion.

Magistrate Brenda Tan said in court she was issuing the arrest warrant because Tang, who fled to Malaysia after losing in a January general election, was unlikely to attend hearings voluntarily to contest the charges.
She issued the warrant at a hearing to charge Tang formally on 33 counts of tax evasion totalling Singapore $211,000 (US$148,000).

She set bail at S$165,000 for Tang, who has been successfully sued for libel by Prime Minister Goh Chok Tong and 10 other leaders of the ruling People's Action Party (PAP). They have demanded record damages of S$12.0 million.

Tang, who was in Hong Kong earlier this week according to the Singapore Straits Times, could be fined three times the amount of tax he is alleged to have evaded plus a fine of S$10,000 on each charge and three years in jail on each count.
